    • Constructor Detail

      • HwlocTopology

        public HwlocTopology()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public int init()
        Allocate a topology context.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_init().

        Returns:
        0 on success, -1 on error.

      • load

        public int load()
        Build the actual topology once initialized with init(). No other routine may be called earlier using this topology.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_load().

        Note

        • On failure, the topology is reinitialized. It should be either destroyed with destroy() or configured and loaded again.
        • This function may be called only once per topology.
        Returns:
        0 on success, -1 on error.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Terminate and free a topology context.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_destroy().

      • check

        public void check()
        Run internal checks on a topology structure. The program aborts if an inconsistency is detected in the given topology.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_check().

        Note

        • This routine is only useful to developers.
        • The input topology should have been previously loaded with load().

      • get_depth

        public int get_depth()
        Get the depth of the hierarchical tree of objects.

        This is the depth of HWLOC.OBJ_PU objects plus one.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_get_depth().

        Returns:
        The depth of the hierarchical tree of objects.

      • is_thissystem

        public boolean is_thissystem()
        Does the topology context come from this system?

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_is_thissystem().

        Returns:
        true if this topology was built using the system running this program. false instead (for instance if using another file-system root, a XML topology file, or a synthetic topology).

      • get_flags

        public java.util.EnumSet<HwlocTopologyFlag> get_flags()
        Get OR'ed flags of HwlocTopologyFlag on this topology.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_get_flags().

        Returns:
        The OR'ed set of HwlocTopologyFlag.

      • get_depth_type

        public HwlocObjectType get_depth_type(int depth)
        Returns the type of objects at depth depth.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_get_depth_type().

        Returns:
        null if depth depth does not exist.

      • get_nbobjs_by_type

        public int get_nbobjs_by_type(HwlocObjectType type)
        Returns the width of level type type.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_get_nbobjs_by_type().

        Returns:
        If no object for that type exists, 0 is returned. If there are several levels with objects of that type, -1 is returned.

      • get_nbobjs_by_depth

        public int get_nbobjs_by_depth(int depth)
        Returns the type of objects at depth depth.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_get_nbobjs_by_depth().

        Returns:
        -1 if depth depth does not exist.

      • get_obj_by_type

        public HwlocObject get_obj_by_type(HwlocObjectType type,
                          int idx)
        Returns the topology object at logical index idx with type type.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_get_obj_by_type().

        Returns:
        If no object for that type exists, null is returned. If there are several levels with objects of that type, null is returned and ther caller may fallback to get_obj_by_depth().

      • get_obj_by_depth

        public HwlocObject get_obj_by_depth(int depth,
                           int idx)
        Returns the topology object at logical index idxdepth.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_get_obj_by_depth().

        Returns:
        If no object for that index and depth exists, null is returned.

      • export_xml

        public int export_xml(java.lang.String xmlpath)
        Export the topology into an XML file.

        This file may be loaded later through set_xml().

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_export_xml().

        Returns:
        -1 if a failure occured.

      • set_xml

        public int set_xml(java.lang.String xmlpath)
        Enable XML-file based topology.

        Gather topology information from the XML file given at xmlpath. Setting the environment variable HWLOC_XML-FILE may also result in this behavior. This file may have been generated earlier with export_xml() or lstopo file.xml.

        Note that this method does not actually load topology information; it just tells hwloc where to load it from. You’ll still need to invoke load() to actually load the topology information.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_set_xml().

        Returns:
        -1 if a failure occured.

      • set_flags

        public int set_flags(java.util.EnumSet<HwlocTopologyFlag> flags)
        Set OR'ed flags of HwlocTopologyFlag to this non-yet-loaded topology.

        If this function is called multiple times, the last invokation will erase and replace the set of flags that was previously set.

        The flags set in the topology may be retrieved with get_flags().

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_set_flags().

        Returns:
        -1 if a failure occured.

      • get_root_obj

        public HwlocObject get_root_obj()
        Returns the top-object of the topology-tree.

        Its type is typically HWLOC.OBJ_MACHINE but it could be different for complex topologies.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_get_root_obj().

        Returns:
        null if a failure occured.

      • get_next_obj_by_depth

        public HwlocObject get_next_obj_by_depth(int depth,
                                HwlocObject prev)
        Returns the next object at depth depth.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_get_next_obj_by_depth().

        Returns:
        If prev is null, return the first object at depth depth.

      • get_next_obj_by_type

        public HwlocObject get_next_obj_by_type(HwlocObjectType type,
                               HwlocObject prev)
        Returns the next object of type type.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_get_next_obj_by_type().

        Returns:
        If prev is null, return the first object at type type. If there are multiple or no depth for given type, return null and let the caller fallback to hwloc_get_next_obj_by_depth().

      • set_cpubind

        public void set_cpubind(HwlocCPUSet cpuset,
               java.util.EnumSet<HwlocCPUBindFlag> flags)
                 throws HwlocException
        Bind current process or thread on CPUs given in physical cpuset.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_set_cpubind().

        Throws:
        HwlocException - if the action is not supported or the binding cannot be enforced.
        HwlocException

      • get_cpubind

        public int get_cpubind(HwlocCPUSet cpuset,
              java.util.EnumSet<HwlocCPUBindFlag> flags)
        Get current process or thread binding.

        Writes into set the physical cpuset which the process or thread (according to flags) was last bound to.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_get_cpubind().

        Returns:
        -1 if a failure occured.

      • get_last_cpu_location

        public int get_last_cpu_location(HwlocCPUSet cpuset,
                        java.util.EnumSet<HwlocCPUBindFlag> flags)
        Get the last physical CPU where the current process or thread ran.

        The operating system may move some tasks from one processor to another at any time according to their binding, so this function may return something that is already outdated.

        flags can include either HWLOC.CPUBIND_PROCESS or HWLOC.CPUBIND_THREAD to specify whether the query should be for the whole process (union of all CPUs on which all threads are running), or only the current thread. If the process is single-threaded, flags can be set to null to let hwloc use whichever method is available on the underlying OS.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_get_last_cpu_location().

        Returns:
        -1 if a failure occured.

      • get_complete_cpuset

        public HwlocCPUSet get_complete_cpuset()
        Get complete CPU set.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_get_complete_cpuset().

        Note

        • The returned cpuset is not newly allocated and should thus not be changed or freed; clone() must be used to obtain a local copy.
        Returns:
        the complete CPU set of logical processors of the system. If the topology is the result of a combination of several systems, null is returned.

      • get_online_cpuset

        public HwlocCPUSet get_online_cpuset()
        Get online CPU set.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_get_online_cpuset().

        Note

        • The returned cpuset is not newly allocated and should thus not be changed or freed; clone() must be used to obtain a local copy.
        Returns:
        the CPU set of online logical processors of the system. If the topology is the result of a combination of several systems, null is returned.

      • get_allowed_cpuset

        public HwlocCPUSet get_allowed_cpuset()
        Get allowed CPU set.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_get_allowed_cpuset().

        Note

        • The returned cpuset is not newly allocated and should thus not be changed or freed; clone() must be used to obtain a local copy.
        Returns:
        the CPU set of allowed logical processors of the system. If the topology is the result of a combination of several systems, null is returned.

      • get_topology_cpuset

        public HwlocCPUSet get_topology_cpuset()
        Get topology CPU set.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_get_topology_cpuset().

        Note

        • The returned cpuset is not newly allocated and should thus not be changed or freed; clone() must be used to obtain a local copy.
        Returns:
        the CPU set of logical processors of the system for which hwloc provides topology information. This is equivalent to the cpuset of the system object. If the topology is the result of a combination of several systems, null is returned.

      • get_complete_nodeset

        public HwlocNodeSet get_complete_nodeset()
        Get complete node set.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_get_complete_nodeset().

        Note

        • The returned nodeset is not newly allocated and should thus not be changed or freed; clone() must be used to obtain a local copy.
        Returns:
        the complete node set of memory of the system. If the topology is the result of a combination of several systems, null is returned.

      • get_topology_nodeset

        public HwlocNodeSet get_topology_nodeset()
        Get allowed node set.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_get_topology_nodeset().

        Note

        • The returned nodeset is not newly allocated and should thus not be changed or freed; clone() must be used to obtain a local copy.
        Returns:
        the node set of allowed memory of the system. If the topology is the result of a combination of several systems, null is returned.

      • get_allowed_nodeset

        public HwlocNodeSet get_allowed_nodeset()
        Get topology CPU set.

        Java binding of the hwloc operation hwloc_topology_get_allowed_nodeset().

        Note

        • The returned nodeset is not newly allocated and should thus not be changed or freed; clone() must be used to obtain a local copy.
        Returns:
        the CPU set of logical processors of the system for which hwloc provides topology information. This is equivalent to the cpuset of the system object. If the topology is the result of a combination of several systems, null is returned.
